title: Types of Marxism Explained (The Far-Left Iceberg)
description:
Go to https://surfshark.com/1dime or use code 1DIME at checkout to get 4 extra months of Surfshark VPN! 
This “Iceberg” video is a fast-paced, complete guide to the various ideologies on The Radical Left, mostly all of the Types of Marxism and Communism, but also some anarchist adjacent tendencies and reformist factions, like Democratic Socialism & Social Democracy. I cover the historical context of these factions, what they believe, and how debates have played out in in real-world politics and today on the Online Left. This guide is accessible and entertaining for newcomers, regardless of political persuasion, but also jam-packed with history and detailed enough for those already very familiar with the weird world of the far left.  

Timestamps for the Ideologies covered in this video (feel free to jump to whatever ideologies you are interested in):

title: Marxism Explained: What They Don't Tell You
description:
Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Keep your information safe. Go to my sponsor https://aura.com/1dime to get a 14-day free trial and see if any of your data has been exposed!

This video is a fun little Introduction to Marxism, told like a story accessible to a broad audience. This mini-documentary summarizes the main ideas of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels and the history of how these ideas would later (after their deaths) turn into the ideology we know as "Marxism." This documentary provides a comprehensive introduction to the core concepts of Marxist theory. We explore historical materialism, dialectical materialism, the labor theory of value, and Karl Marx's powerful critique of capitalism. If you want to understand the foundational ideas of Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels, this beginner's guide is the perfect starting point. The video explains complex concepts like the dictatorship of the proletariat, the transition from socialism to communism, and what made Marxist  "scientific socialism" different from other socialist ideologies. 

Timestamps: 

00:00 The Most Influential Thinker in Modern History?
02:24 Industrial Capitalism & Revolutionary Change
05:10 Scientific Socialism: Marxism vs Other Socialisms
10:44 Historical Materialism 
11:52 Labor and The Theory of History
14:27 Why The Working Class? 
17:32 The Dictatorship of the Proletariat, Socialism, Communism
22:14 How “Marxism” Became a Doctrine 
27:00 The First "Marxist" Party
30:04 The appetizer before the main course

title: The Capitalist Matrix: What EVERYONE Gets Wrong
description:
Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Keep your personal information safe. Go to my sponsor https://aura.com/1dime to get a 14-day free trial and see how much of your data is being sold by data brokers online.

This video essay serves three purposes.

1) To understand Why Social Democracy is Not Enough and why nearly ALL governments still govern in favor of the dominant classes. 
2) To explain the Marxist theory of the capitalist state and what oversimplified versions of it get wrong. Most notably, the notion of a "dictatorship of the bourgeoisie" is misleading and cannot account for the fact that the ruling class need not "rule" the government (directly or indirectly) in order to still "rule" society.
 3) To explain how the working class are systemically excluded from institutional power and from changing the state and its legal code, the code that enables the reproduction of capitalism.  

Timestamps: 

0:00 The "Establishment"
2:35 It's not just corporate lobbying
4:50 What's bad about capitalism again? 
8:23 The Ruling Class Need Not Rule
10:34 Divisions in the Ruling Class
16:40 Nobody Is in Control 
21:19 How The "Matrix" Works 
27:32 Legal Codes and Ideology
35:03 The Limits of Small Reforms

title: The Cycle of Empires: The Political Philosophy of Dune
description:
Exclusive content on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Read more with Speechify: https://speechify.com/?utm_campaign=partners&utm_content=rewardful&via=1Dime

In this video, we look at the politics of the Dune series by Frank Herbert through the lens of Ibn Khaldun, and in turn, we explore Ibn Khaldun's theories through the lens Dune. Ibn Khaldun was a 14th-century historian, philosopher, sociologist, economist,  and "social scientist" more broadly. He is most famous for the "Muqaddimah." Through the lens of the Dune I and Dune II movies (and the Dune Novel series more broadly), we will explore Ibn Khaldun's proto-realist theory of religion, group power, the rise and fall of civilizations, and the cycle of empires. Enjoy! 

Timestamp:

0:00 Intro
2:00 Ibn Khaldun’s Influence on Dune
6:20 Group Solidarity & Collective Power
10:55 Theory of Religion
18:04 Royal Authority & The State
24:46 Prophets & Charismatic Leaders
28:44 Religion vs Group Solidarity
32:35 The Cycle of Civilizations

title: Inverted Totalitarianism: The Slow Death of American Democracy
description:
Compare news coverage and stay informed with Ground News news by subscribing through my link https://ground.news/1dime to receive 40% off unlimited access through the Vantage Subscription.

Help support 1Dime on Patreon and get access to exclusive content: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime

This 1Dime video is a documentary about the history and evolution of US Democracy, based on the political theory of Sheldon Wolin and his book “Democracy Incorporated: Managed Democracy and the Specter of Inverted Totalitarianism” and the Expanded Edition of his book “Politics and Vision: Continuity and Innovation in Western Political Thought.” Wolin’s theories, popularized by the likes of Chris Hedges and Noam Chomsky, are very important for understanding the nature of the American system and what makes it different from other capitalist liberal democracies. My own work (seen in the 1Dime videos and my upcoming book "Freedom To Change Nothing: The Spectrum of Managed Democracy and What Makes the US Different") builds on Wolin’s book "Democracy Incorporated: Managed Democracy and the Specter of Inverted Totalitarianism" and adds a lot to his theories while also going beyond them, covering certain things Wolin missed. 

The decline of Democracy in America and the rise of authoritarianism did not start with Donald Trump. The democratic deficit goes much deeper, and the situation we are currently in is the product of many historical precedents set over a long period of history. The fate of democracy depends on our ability to confront this history. Watch the full video to see why. 

0:00 What Makes America Different 
4:42 What is Democracy? 
10:16 Managed Democracy & Inverted Totalitarianism

26:37 Total War & the Red Scare

title: Herbert Marcuse: The Most Hated Philosopher
description:
Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Read more with Speechify: https://speechify.com/?utm_campaign=partners&utm_content=rewardful&via=1Dime
Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial

This is a video essay documentary on The Philosophy of Herbert Marcuse, particularly his book titled "One-Dimensional Man." Marcuse is one of the most famous philosophers of the 20th century from the notorious  “Frankfurt School” of Critical Theory. Marcuse is often thought of as a “Guru of the New Left” and is often misunderstood by those who only read his book “Eros and Civilization” but not his later works such as One-Dimensional Man and Counter-Revolution and Revolt. Marcuse became a contentious figure due to being a mentor to Angela Davis and giving (critical) support to the Student Movement of 1968 and the late 60s. 

Timestamp:

0:00 Most Controversial Philosopher 
2:40 Marcuse & The Frankfurt School 
7:51 Guru of the New Left? CIA agent? 
10:17 A New Totalitarianism? 
14:06 Technological Rationality
17:38 One-Dimensional Thought
22:04 Democratic Unfreedom, Repressive Tolerance 
26:22 The Technological Society
28:09 Desublimation and The Paradox of Sexual Liberation
32:42 Counter-Revolution and Revolt

title: The Politics of Tupac Shakur
description:
Keep your personal information safe. Go to my sponsor, https://aura.com/1dime to get a 14-day free trial and see how much of your data is being sold by data brokers online.

Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime

Was Tupac a Communist? Why did the FBI have a file on him? Find out more in this mini documentary on the Politics of rapper/hip hop artist Tupac Shakur (2Pac), his leftist upbringing, his radical family background, the Marxist politics of the Shakur family, his ambitious “THUG LIFE” project, the FBI File on him, and lastly, his tragic, mysterious death.  #blackhistorymonth 

In doing so, we will critically explore some of the insights of John Potash’s Book “The FBI’s War on Tupac” while maintaining fidelity to the truth and factual accuracy. 

This is a surprise video that has secretly been in the works for a long time to end Black History Month. This one is quite different from other 1Dime videos. Enjoy! #blackhistorymonth2023

title: The Theory of Controlled Opposition
description:
Compare news coverage, spot media bias, and stay informed with Ground News news by subscribing through my link https://ground.news/1dime to receive 30% off unlimited access through the Vantage Subscription, which is about $5/month.

Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
My Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial

This video is about the notion of "controlled opposition," whereby I present an alternative theory called "Contained Opposition and the Desublimation of Protest.” This theory addresses some major gaps in contemporary understandings of power, resistance, good governance, and how "liberal democracies" such as the US maintain hegemony in comparison to other regimes. In order to change the world, we need to first understand how our current Society of Control ( “The Matrix” of our existing system) works. 

Most importantly, this video addresses the problems such as the cycle of activist burnout, depoliticization, and the trap of protest demonstrations. Those who liked the visual style of The Burnout Society video will enjoy this new 1Dime experiment. I wanted the aesthetic of this video to be as engaging as a Johnny Harris video, but more artistic and gritty. If you enjoy it, leave a comment and share these videos with your friends, family, and anyone who you think should see this.

title: The Two-Party Simulation
description:
Why People STILL Believe in US Democracy.
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
Check out my  podcast 1Dime Radio (on all podcast platforms)
Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial

Why is the United States still considered a "legitimate" liberal democracy unlike the "Phantom Democracies" seen in countries such as Russia, Turkey, and Singapore? Does having a Two-Party System make America more democratic than a one-party state? Could the election of Donald Trump lead to the end of democracy? As we will see, "The Real Threat to American Democracy" involves a lot more than Trump. The argument being made in this video essay is NOT merely that the US is not a democracy or that America's Two-Party Corporate Duopoly is undemocratic. This video is about a LOT more than that. This video is also about the "Simulation of Democracy" and how different types of regimes legitimize their authority. In this video, we consider whether the USA is also a "phantom democracy" and how the American regime maintains greater democratic "legitimacy" compared to other countries with nominally "democratic" systems that lack real democratic substance. 

In the second half, I draw on the theories of Jean Baudrillard on Simulation and Hyperreality to understand why most Americans, even those on the left, still buy into the spectacle of American Politics and the facade of US electoralism despite the obvious democratic deficit in American society and its elections. I consider the role of Donald Trump's election and whether Trumpism and "populism" represent a threat to the legitimacy of American Democracy OR if this actually reinforces the myth of democracy.  Lastly, I consider how democratic revolutions differed in America compared to Europe and how the unique legacy of the American Revolution fosters national mythology that obstructs democratization.

Timestamps: 

0:00 What counts as a "Real Democracy"?
2:38 The Two-Party Duopoly 
4:16 “Power Sharing”
8:08 “Party Competition” 
9:53 Perceived Legitimacy 
11:37 Phantom Democracy 
13:43 Simulation and Hyperreal Politics
16:13 Donald Trump and the Future of U.S. Democracy
19:25 The Democratic Revolution

Thanks to ​⁠​⁠​⁠@SecondThought ​⁠​⁠​⁠@researchpurposes and ​⁠​⁠​⁠@Gokanaru for reading quotes.

Sources I mentioned and books for further reading: 
G William Domhoff, Who Rules America? (the 2021 edition)
The Power Elite by C Wright Mills
The New Despotism by John Keane (Written by a liberal political theorist who outlines the concept of “Phantom Democracy” but strangely does not apply it to the US)
 Political Power and Social Classes by Nicos Poulantzas
Prisoners of the American Dream by Mike Davis
https://act.represent.us/sign/problempoll-fba
My Cosmonaut Article: why-the-ruling-class-need-not-rule-nicos-poulantzas-and-the-marxist-theory-of-the-state https://cosmonautmag.com/2023/11/why-the-ruling-class-need-not-rule-nicos-poulantzas-and-the-marxist-theory-of-the-state/
The other articles I mentioned are displayed on screen in the video.

description:

title: China's Cultural Revolution: The Full Story (Documentary)
description:
Watch Part 2: https://youtu.be/7WFd5kYItHI?si=R5i9pJXtJw7FzPIT
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries

In this 1Dime documentary, I attempt to provide a relatively balanced historical account of one of the most misunderstood events in modern history: The Chinese Cultural Revolution (The CR), also known as the "Great Proletarian Cultural Revolution" (GPCR) launched by Mao Zedong. In this video, we explore how the Cultural Revolution began, what happened, how it ended, and what Chairman Mao’s goal was with it. 

The Cultural Revolution is easily the most misunderstood era of Mao's China and the history of the People's Republic of China as a whole. The Cultural Revolution has had a significant impact on modern China and to this day, the CPC likes to tightly regulate the discourse surrounding it. As we will see, this is because the Cultural Revolution and the Red Guard rebellions that it unleashed represented the biggest threat to the Communist Party of China in its history.

Sources/Books where I got my research from:

-The Cultural Revolution: A Very Short Introduction by Richard Kraus 
-Mao’s China and After by Maurice Meisner

title: Putin's Real Ideology
description:
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime

The 3rd and final episode of the 1Dime docuseries on Post-Soviet Russia.
Part 1: https://youtu.be/o8d6Vzi7zYg
Part 2: https://youtu.be/zODWTfMwFGw

Timestamp: 
0:00 The Conservative Turn and Need For Legitimacy
3:14 Culture Wars and Anti-Liberalism
7:37 Eurasianism and Alexander Dugin
10:48 Anti-imperialist?
14:35 Cynicism and Confusion 
16:40 Putin's Relationship with the Soviet Union

Videos I Mentioned: 
1: https://youtu.be/PTmnVJxrsAQ
2: https://youtu.be/SY9NjD_5WWo

This video is about how Ideology has changed in Post-Soviet Russia and the various tactics of social control that enable the Putin regime to rule. Some of these include culture war tactics that have now become quite prevalent in North America today.  Many liberals have tried to pin down the actions of the Kremlin to a particular "ideology" of the Putin Regime. However, such approaches that overstate the role of ideology in driving Putin's actions miss the bigger picture: which is that the ideology of the Putin regime is actually quite vacuous and is merely a flexible rhetorical device for rationalizing the Kremlin's foreign policy and legitimizing The United Russia Party's rule. As we have seen since the first episode of this series  Ideology of the Putin regime has changed greatly over time, from pro-western aspirations and an open commitment to Neoliberalism to a conservative collectivist shift that transpired in accordance with the souring of Russia-US Ties. 

Credits: 
Written, Narrated, and Directed by 1Dime
Edited by Jeff Skyward 
Animations by Biodegradable 

Sources/Books that inspired this video:
-Dissidents among Dissidents: Ideology, Politics and the Left in Post-Soviet Russia by Ilya Budraitskis
-Change in Putin's Russia: Power, Money and People by Simon Pirani
-Nothing Is True, and Everything Is Possible: The Surreal Heart of the New Russia by Peter Pomerantsev. 
-Russia Without Putin by Tony Wood

title: The Problem with Space Exploration
description:
This is a video about The Space Economy and the Geopolitics of space exploration under capitalism versus the potentials of space exploration under socialism. Under capitalism, the privatization of space poses serious concerns, but what could a socialist vision of space exploration look like? 

Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Listen to my podcast 1Dime Radio (on all platforms)

Often people on the left (such as Bernie Sanders) dismiss Space Exploration as a waste of money and time. However, there are many benefits to space exploration, especially under a more egalitarian society.

Enjoy the trippy visuals (:

title: The Deficit Myth: The Biggest Lie In Politics
description:
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
Buy Me a Coffee: https://ko-fi.com/1dime
Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial
Check out my podcast 1Dime Radio (on all podcast platforms)

The truth about inflation, money printing, taxes, fiat currency, and "the national debt." Debunking lies about what causes inflation and common misconceptions about government spending and "taxpayer money." 

Does the national debt actually matter? Do budget deficits matter? Can governments ever run out of money? Can governments print money forever? Does printing money lead to hyperinflation? What causes inflation? What is the point of Taxes?  Do we really need taxes?  How did the government pay for all of it's big spending stimulus packages? In this video, we use Modern Monetary Theory and real world facts to debunk deficit hawks and pro-austerity taking points.

title: Planet of the Robots: The Four Futures of AI
description:
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial

A mini documentary about four possible futures after capitalism in a world of increasing automation and Artificial Intelligence. This video is part of a collaboration with JT from Second Thought. Check out their video after this! The production of this video was made possible entirely by Patrons. Become a Patron if you want to make ambitious projects like this possible!

Buy Me a Coffee: https://ko-fi.com/1dime
Check out my podcast 1Dime Radio (on all podcast platforms)

Automation under capitalism or Automation under socialism? The differences would be life changing and could manifest in various ways. How could automation impact our lives? Who will own the robots?  In this video we explore four possible futures.  However, these futures could intersect and we may not just get one of them, as some of the futures are highly related to each other and are already relevant to capitalist societies today. This video analyzes the relationship between automation, post-scarcity, climate change, and political economy using Peter Frase's book titled "Four Futures: Life After Capitalism" among other works.

title: The Culture Industry and The Death of Hip Hop
description:
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial

What happened to Hip Hop Music? How did it become commercialized? What is "Mumble Rap"?  Find out in this video about The Culture Industry.

This video explores how Capitalism impacted Hip Hop music using Theodor Adorno’s theory of “The Culture Industry” and “Standardization” in Popular Music. We go over how corporate incentives and consumer ideology impact the production of rap music and how one dimensional standardized music formulas condition how people listen to music. We also discuss how various aspects of the music industry such as the media spectacle, marketing, corporate interests, streaming platforms, and record labels impact rap music both in terms of sound and its materialistic subject matter.

Intro by Artin Salimi: https://www.youtube.com/c/ArtinSalimi

title: Acid Communism
description:
Enjoy the Trip!  
Support 1Dime on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
Twitter: https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial
Check out my podcast 1Dime Radio (on all podcast platforms)

What was Mark Fisher working towards with his concept of Acid Communism? In this video, we discuss the relationship between the 1960's Counterculture, hippies, psychedelia, and past & present socialist movements. We will analyze the problems and lost potentials of these movements through the lens of the late Mark Fisher's concepts of "Acid Communism" , Capitalist Realism, Lost Futures, Hauntology, and Post-Work. We will interpret the potential uses of psychedelic culture and its implications on consciousness.  We also critique problems with rational and strictly material appeals in the contemporary left and discuss how the left should regard spirituality and higher desires for things like meaning, freedom, and free time.

0:49 Rational vs Psychological Appeals
7:35 May 1968
9:20 1960s Counterculture
15:52 Lost Futures
18:43 Socialism Freedom and Mental Health
21:50 Ego and Political Identity
23:51 Machiavellian Spirituality
24:35 Outro

To be clear: We do not endorse or condone the use of any illegal substances

title: The Burnout Society: Hustle Culture, Self Help, and PsychoPolitics
description:
Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime
Email 1dimeman@gmail.com for inquiries
Twitter:  https://twitter.com/1DimeOfficial

A Documentary about how Hustle Culture, Workaholism, Toxic Productivity, Self Improvement, and Self-Help gurus like Gary Vaynerchuk function as a form of what the Philosopher Byung-Chul Han calls “Psychopolitics.” Psychopolitics is a form of smart power that governs our Neoliberal Society of Control. Hustle Culture and Positive Psychology (Toxic Positivity) are just some of its many manifestations. It is leading to burnout, depression, and anxiety. 

Support my work on Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/OneDime

#HustleCulture #byungchulhan  #Selfhelp

title: Why Billionaires Prefer Democrats
description:

Do Billionaires support Democrats? Which Billionaires support Democrats? Why would Billionaires Prefer Democrats? This video is a systemic analysis of the long term and short term interests of capitalism and the politics that regulate it. The question as to why many billionaires like Bill Gates, Warren Buffett, and Jeff Bezos support and/or vote for Democrats does get addressed so we highly suggest watching the video essay to the end to get the full picture.
